title: How much crude does India get from Russia & will it stop after US penalty threat?
content: India faces potential US penalties due to its continued trade relations with Russia, specifically regarding oil and defence equipment purchases. Despite international pressure and sanctions, India has significantly increased its reliance on discounted Russian oil, now comprising a substantial portion of its imports.

title: Umar Ansari arrested: Accused of forging documents; tried to claim father Mukhtar’s seized property
content: Umar Ansari, son of Mukhtar Ansari, was arrested in Lucknow on Sunday night. Ghazipur police made the arrest. He is accused of trying to reclaim property seized under the Gangsters Act. Officials say he submitted forged documents with fake signatures of his mother, Afsa Ansari. This is the sixth case against Umar.

title: Bill Gates: AI today can replace human work; but it is not …
content: Bill Gates believes AI is rapidly advancing, capable of handling simple coding tasks but not yet the most complex ones. Experts disagree on whether AI will master complex coding within two years or a decade. Gates highlights AI's potential to replace telesales jobs, impacting various sectors.

title: Trump sees Islamabad selling oil to New Delhi! Here's the reality of Pakistan's 'massive' reserves
content: Harsh Goenka mocked Donald Trump's suggestion of Pakistan selling oil to India, deeming it highly improbable. Trump claimed a deal with Pakistan to develop its 'massive' oil reserves, potentially leading to sales to India. However, Pakistan's proven reserves are significantly smaller than India's, and it heavily relies on oil imports, making Trump's scenario unlikely.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-year-old AI researcher who rejected $125 million job offer, and then ...
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: 'Disinformation being spread': MEA squashes speculation over India's response to Trump's tariff
content: The ministry of external affairs refuted social media claims about India reviewing agreements with the US. This came amid trade tensions and tariff threats from US President Donald Trump. Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged Indians to support local products. He highlighted global economic uncertainty. Modi called for a nationwide Swadeshi movement. He emphasized national unity to boost India's economy.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‘I think we have to....'
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: Stephen A Smith blasts Michelle Obama over ESPN drama jab and offensive Donald Trump claim
content: In August 2025, Michelle Obama's podcast comparison of ESPN's debate shows to 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta' ignited a feud with Stephen A. Smith. Smith responded sharply, criticizing her past campaign remarks as offensive and emotionally manipulative. He defended ESPN's commentary as authentic entertainment, highlighting the cultural divides in media and political messaging.

title: IND vs ENG: Bazball hits brick wall - India’s final hour surge takes the series into deciding Day 5
content: A dramatic final session on Day 4 at The Oval injected life into the Test match. Indian seamers, led by Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna, bowled with intensity, creating numerous chances. Despite England's strong position, India's spirited effort, fueled by Joe Root's wicket and Jacob Bethell's dismissal, ignited the crowd.

title: Protests mark Hasina's exit: Student-led party seeks new constitution
content: A new political party, formed by student leaders of anti-government protests, rallied in Dhaka, advocating for a new constitution and a 'new Bangladesh.' Simultaneously, the BNP mobilized supporters, urging youth engagement before upcoming elections. These rallies occurred amidst criticism of the interim government's handling of law and order, marking increased political activity as the anniversary of Sheikh Hasina's ouster approaches.

title: Brooke Hogan’s husband: Hulk Hogan showed no interest in meeting grandkids
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: Hailee Steinfeld's latest workout photos break the internet
content: While Josh Allen focuses on football, Hailee Steinfeld prioritizes her well-being through fitness and mindfulness. She emphasizes the importance of workouts for mental clarity and emotional resilience, supported by her father, Pete Steinfeld, a personal trainer. Hailee embraces balance, letting go of past body image struggles and finding joy in her wellness journey, setting an example of inner strength.

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' — motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: Gurgaon horror: Wife plots husband’s murder with lover, 3 others; all arrested
content: In Gurugram, police have apprehended five individuals, including a woman and her neighbor, for the alleged murder of her husband. Soni Devi and her neighbor Ravindra conspired to kill Vikram after their affair was discovered. Ravindra, along with accomplices, strangled Vikram and buried his body with the help of his uncle, while Soni Devi filed a false missing person report to mislead the investigation.

title: 'Natural leader' Siraj is getting recognition: Morne Morkel
content: Morne Morkel lauded Mohammed Siraj's consistent performance throughout the Test series against England, highlighting his leadership qualities. Siraj emerged as India's leading wicket-taker with 20 scalps. Morkel acknowledged the team's resilience despite England's strong position, emphasizing the importance of breaking partnerships. He remains hopeful for a turnaround, contingent on favorable conditions and precise bowling.

title: 'Misleading, baseless': EC fact-checks Chidambaram's migrant voters claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has refuted Congress MP P Chidambaram's claims regarding voter shifts and migrant inclusion in Tamil Nadu, labeling them as misleading and baseless. The EC clarified that the SIR exercise hasn't been rolled out in Tamil Nadu yet, making the connection to Bihar's voter list absurd. Chidambaram had questioned the addition of 6.

title: Watch: Part of Patna flyover sinks; was inaugurated 2 months ago
content: A section of Patna's new double-deck flyover has sunk. This happened after persistent heavy rainfall. The flyover cost Rs 422 crore. Nitish Kumar, Bihar's Chief Minister, inaugurated it on June 11, 2025. The structure spans the busy Ashok Rajpath. Residents face flooding due to poor drainage. The flyover aimed to reduce congestion.

title: ‘He wants her to feel safe’: Travis Kelce prioritizing Taylor Swift’s privacy
content: Travis Kelce recently shared rare photos with Taylor Swift on social media, a move reportedly discussed with the pop star beforehand. Sources reveal Kelce prioritized Swift's comfort and privacy, ensuring she approved of the images before posting. While Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift remains out of the public eye, their relationship nears the two-year mark.

title: Kolkata shocker: Man dies by suicide fearing deportation to Bangladesh over NRC
content: Dilip Kumar Saha, a 63-year-old Kolkata resident, was found dead in his home, with his family attributing his suicide to fears of deportation due to the potential implementation of the National Register of Citizens (NRC).

title: IND vs ENG: Joe Root equals Sunil Gavaskar, breaks multiple records in The Oval masterclass vs India
content: Joe Root's magnificent 39th Test century propelled England closer to their target against India at The Oval. His century played a crucial role in England's ongoing chase. Root surpassed Kumar Sangakkara's record, now standing fourth in all-time Test century makers. This was Root's 13th ton against India, the most by any batter.

title: Semiconductor mission: How India is stepping up its chip revolution
content: India is rapidly transforming its semiconductor industry with strong government support and significant investments, aiming to become a key global player. The India Semiconductor Mission, with a Rs 76,000 crore budget, drives manufacturing, design, and R&D. Approved projects from major companies like Tata and Micron will boost chip production.

title: India ignores Trump threat: No order to refiners to stop buying Russian oil, claims report
content: Despite US pressure and potential penalties, India has not directed its oil refiners to halt Russian crude purchases, prioritizing energy security and diplomatic ties. Refiners continue sourcing oil based on commercial factors, even as contingency plans for alternative sources are explored.

title: 'Rahul Gandhi is anti-India': Himanta Biswa Sarma's fresh jibe at Congress MP
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma launched a scathing attack on Rahul Gandhi, branding him "anti-national" and accusing him of supporting Bangladeshi and Pakistani Muslims. This came after Gandhi criticized Sarma, alleging corruption and predicting his imprisonment. Sarma retaliated, dismissing Gandhi's claims and asserting his connection to Assam, while accusing the Congress leader of outdated thinking.

title: IND vs ENG: Dropped and punished: How many runs did Brook score after Siraj's miss?
content: In a Test match, Siraj's error proved costly for India. He touched the boundary while taking a catch. This gave Brook six runs instead of a dismissal. Brook then scored 111 runs. His innings shifted the game's momentum. Later, Siraj caught Brook. But the earlier mistake impacted India's chances. The dropped catch and Brook's innings became a defining moment.

title: Tejashwi's dual voter ID row: EC issues notice to RJD leader, asks him to hand over EPIC card
content: The Election Commission has issued a notice to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav regarding discrepancies in his EPIC numbers. The ECI clarified that one of the EPIC numbers Yadav mentioned doesn't officially exist, requesting further details for investigation. This action follows Yadav's allegations of his name missing from the electoral rolls, which the ECI refuted, stating his name is indeed listed and accusing him of making false claims.

title: Dak Prescott builds new mansion after tearing down previous one: Here's why
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott is rebuilding his Texas mansion in Prosper, aiming for a more contemporary and intimate design. Construction began after he demolished his previous multi-million-dollar estate in October 2024. The new structure, featuring clean lines and compartmentalized segments, appears to be a luxurious, multi-story residence.

title: Watch: Thousands of Palestine supporters 'March for Humanity' in Sydney
content: Thousands of pro-Palestine supporters rallied in Sydney. They marched across the Harbour Bridge. The protesters demanded more aid for Gaza. They also sought sanctions against Israel. The demonstration followed government signals of potential recognition of a Palestinian state. Organizers accused Israel of genocide. The protest highlighted calls for a ceasefire and unrestricted humanitarian assistance.

title: Joe Root breaks massive record; becomes first to achieve feat against India
content: Joe Root's resilient half-century on Day 4 of the fifth Test against India at The Oval bolstered England's chase, equaling Herbie Taylor's record with 16 fifty-plus scores against an opponent in home Tests. Root, alongside Harry Brook, stabilized England's innings after early wickets, steering them towards a potential series-clinching victory.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Will have to admit that England are ...' - Sunil Gavaskar's brutal response to India winning more sessions
content: India faces a potential series defeat against England in the fifth Test, with Joe Root and Harry Brook's dominant partnership pushing the hosts closer to victory. Sunil Gavaskar emphasized that only a win can level the series and acknowledge India's competitiveness. Brook's rapid century, aided by a costly dropped catch, further diminishes India's hopes as England approaches the target.

title: TMC accuses Delhi Police of insulting Bangla; seeks Amit Shah's apology
content: Abhishek Banerjee, a senior Trinamool Congress leader, has strongly criticized the BJP after a Delhi police letter referred to Bengali as "Bangladeshi language." Banerjee condemned this as a deliberate insult and an attempt to undermine Bengali identity, accusing the BJP of systematically maligning Bengal and its culture.

title: 'I'm going to propose to you': WCL owner's Live TV act leaves presenter stunned
content: South Africa Champions secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over Pakistan Champions in the World Championship of Legends final, propelled by AB de Villiers' stunning century. Off the field, league owner Harshit Tomar proposed to presenter Karishma Kotak live on air, creating a viral moment.

title: 'What was he thinking?'- Ponting lambasts Siraj for costly fielding blunder
content: Ricky Ponting slammed Mohammed Siraj for dropping Harry Brook's catch, which resulted in a six, during the crucial final hour of the morning session on Day 4. Brook's aggressive counterattack, drawing comparisons to Rishabh Pant, shifted the momentum back to England after India initially gained control by taking early wickets. The match witnessed a seesaw battle between the two teams.

title: Prisoner number 15528: How Prajwal Revanna spent his first night in jail
content: Prajwal Revanna, designated prisoner number 15528, faced a tearful first night in Bengaluru's prison after receiving a life sentence for raping a domestic worker. Emotionally overwhelmed, he broke down during a medical examination, informing staff of his high court challenge to the conviction.

title: Missing for days: 4 Indian-origin senior citizens killed in US car crash; were going to temple
content: An Indian-origin family of four, travelling from Buffalo to Pittsburgh, has gone missing, prompting a search operation. Asha, Kishore, Shailesh, and Gita Divan were headed to West Virginia after stopping at a Burger King in Erie, Pennsylvania. Their cell phones are unanswered since Tuesday, and they never checked into their pre-booked lodging.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I won't lose my wicket' - Akash Deep reveals pep-talk that charged him up
content: Akash Deep's resilient 66 as nightwatchman on Day 3 of the Oval Test significantly boosted India's position. His crucial century stand with Yashasvi Jaiswal stabilized the innings, contributing to India's 396 total. Akash revealed his overnight determination to contribute meaningfully, emphasizing his resolve not to carelessly lose his wicket in the 2nd innings.

title: 'Cong to reveal serious malpractices of ECI', says Venugopal; declares date
content: The Congress party has accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of "bias" in the ongoing revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, alleging voter exclusion. Senior Congress leader KC Venugopal announced plans to reveal "serious malpractices" on August 5 in Bengaluru. The ECI released draft rolls for Bihar, inviting claims and objections, while opposition parties raised concerns about potential voter deletion.

title: Travis Kelce’s family mourns death of Ed Kelce’s partner at 74
content: Ed Kelce, father of NFL stars Travis and Jason Kelce, announced the passing of his partner, Maureen Maguire, on August 1, 2025, at the age of 74. Maguire, who grew to love football, often accompanied Ed to games and events. She famously joked with Taylor Swift about her relationship with Ed.

title: Chennai shocker: Man beheads wife over suspected infidelity
content: A CRPF constable, Tamil Selvan, was arrested in Chennai for beheading his wife in Tuticorin district due to suspicions of infidelity. After murdering Uma Maheshwari, he surrendered his children to his father-in-law and fled. Seeking to publicly discuss the crime, he approached a news channel, whose staff alerted the police, leading to his capture.

title: IND vs ENG : Mohammed Siraj's bizarre blunder leaves Prasidh Krishna red-faced
content: Harry Brook's aggressive batting put India under pressure in the ongoing Test match. Prasidh Krishna's celebration was cut short when Mohammed Siraj inadvertently crossed the boundary rope while taking a catch. Brook got six runs instead of being dismissed. The incident highlighted the match's dramatic shifts as England aims to win the series, while India fights to level it.

title: ‘Trains communists ...': Report accuses Harvard of having ties with CCP
content: Harvard University faces scrutiny over its decade-long partnerships with organizations linked to the Chinese Communist Party. A congressional probe revealed collaborations with entities like the Central Organisation Department and the Chinese Executive Leadership Academy Pudong. Concerns are mounting about potential foreign influence and national security risks, especially regarding the training of Chinese officials.

title: RB Cook sits out Bills' practice: 'Just business'
content: Bills running back James Cook did not participate in a mandatory practice for the first time since seeking an extension this offseason.

title: Hip-drop tackle severely injures Colts RB Ahmed
content: Colts backup running back Salvon Ahmed suffered a severe injury to his lower right leg after a hip-drop tackle during practice and was taken to a hospital for X-rays.

title: Source: S Johnson broke leg in Crosby collision
content: Raiders safety Lonnie Johnson Jr. has suffered a broken fibula and will get an MRI to determine if there is additional damage, a source told ESPN.

title: Sun prez: Sale not done, staying in Conn. in '26
content: Sun president Jennifer Rizzotti said the team plans to play at Mohegan Sun Arena in 2026 after a deal was reached for a Boston-based group to buy the franchise and relocate it in '27.

title: Rodman in tears after winning goal in Spirit return
content: Washington Spirit forward Trinity Rodman returned to the field for the first time in nearly four months on Sunday in Washington's game against the Portland Thorns.

title: Yamashita holds off Hull to win Women's Open
content: Miyu Yamashita withstood a charge by Charley Hull to capture the Women's Open Championship for her first major victory.

title: U.S. women set 4x100 medley relay WR at worlds
content: The U.S. women's 4x100 medley relay team of Gretchen Walsh, Regan Smith, Kate Douglas and Torri Huske set a world record at the swimming world championships, while Summer McIntosh and Leon Marchand both picked up another gold.

title: 🏀 Answering the biggest Luka-Lakers questions
content: The Luka Era officially begins on Saturday, when Doncic signs a three-year extension with the Lakers. Here's what you need to know about the deal.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: How Bijan Robinson and Christian McCaffrey are forming a competitive bond
content: Along with Luke McCaffrey, the players shared tips about performance and recovery during offseason workouts.

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Ruben Amorim Q&A: 'It's Manchester United; we need to return to Europe'
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim talks to ESPN about changing the club's culture, Alejandro Garnacho's future, and exchanging GIFs with Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Ramos as Sesko backup
content: Newcastle could turn to PSG's Gonçalo Ramos if their pursuit of Benjamin Sesko stalls. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: ⚾ MLB trade grades: Report cards for biggest deals
content: How did you team fare as a flurry of deals came down to the wire? Here's our scorecard for all the big moves.

title: 😡 Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Source: Teammate offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: ↔️ Barnwell's NFL trade tiers for all 32 teams
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: 🏈 Deion says he's cancer-free after surgery
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: 🏀 Grading every NBA team's offseason
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Who Is Dmitry Medvedev, The Russian War Hawk Who Got Under Trump's Skin?
content: Former Russian president Dmitry Medvedev has become embroiled in a tense back-and-forth on social media that prompted US President Donald Trump to announce he had ordered the repositioning of two US nuclear submarines.

title: Students Rally In Dhaka, Pledge To Build A 'New Bangladesh'
content: A new political party formed by the students who spearheaded an anti-government movement ousting former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina on Sunday rallied in Bangladesh's capital and pledged to build a new Bangladesh.

title: Trial Of Sheikh Hasina Begins In Bangladesh Over Crimes Against Humanity
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) on Sunday commenced the trial of deposed Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in absentia over crimes against humanity related to the violent suppression of the 2024 student-led protests.

title: 63-Year-Old Man Dies By Suicide, 'Feared Being Deported To Bangladesh'
content: A 63-year-old man was found hanging in his residence in Kolkata on Sunday morning, with his family claiming that he had been living in fear that he would be sent to Bangladesh if the National Register of Citizens (NRC) was implemented.

title: "Some Don't Agree To Share Power": DK Shivakumar At Congress Event In Delhi
content: Congress's DK Shivakumar, seen as engaged in a tussle with his boss - Chief Minister Siddaramaiah -- over the top post in Karnataka, made a few pointed remarks while praising the Gandhi family in Delhi today.

title: 'Private Part Cut Off, Body Dumped' Of Odisha Man Over 'Witchcraft' Suspicion
content: A group of people killed a 35-year-old man and cut off his private part allegedly on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Odisha's Gajapati district, police said on Sunday.

title: Manipur Approves New Police Infra In Districts For Transformative Impact
content: The Manipur government has approved a significant proposal submitted by the police department to set up a new secretariat police station in Mantripukhri, and create 12 sub-divisional police officers (SDPO) posts in districts across the state.

title: "Insulting": Mamata Banerjee On Delhi Police Terming Bengali As "Bangladeshi National Language"
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamta Banerjee on Sunday lashed out at the Delhi Police for referring to the Bengali language as "Bangladeshi national language" in a purported letter, alleging that it was "insulting, anti-national and unconstitutional".

title: 31-Year-Old Man 'Beaten To Death' In Private Haryana Detox Centre
content: The family of a 31-year-old man, who lost his life while undergoing treatment at a private de-addiction centre here, on Sunday alleged foul play behind his death and claimed that he was thrashed, an official said.

title: Government Will Never Evict Indian, Assamese People: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the government will never evict "any Indian or Assamese people", a day after he stated that unauthorised occupation of public land by indigenous people is not considered as encroachment.

title: Man Dies After Being "Beaten Up" By BSF Personnel In Assam
content: A 30-year-old man died after allegedly being thrashed by a few Border Security Force (BSF) personnel in Assam's Cachar district, triggering protests by locals, an official said on Sunday.

title: India's US Envoy Meets Tulsi Gabbard To Discuss "Mutual Interests"
content: Indian Ambassador Vinay Mohan Kwatra on Sunday met with US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard and held an "engaging conversation" on various issues of mutual interest.

title: "A For Akhilesh": Samajwadi Party Leader Faces Case For Teaching "Politicised Alphabets"
content: A First Information Report (FIR) has been registered against a local Samajwadi Party leader in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur for allegedly teaching "politicised alphabets" to children.

title: Trump Repeats Claim He Settled War Between India And Pak With Trade
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday yet again took credit for stopping conflicts around the world, including the recent one between India and Pakistan.

title: Delhi Chief Minister On Air Quality Dipping To 74 For The First Time In A Decade
content: Citing the latest Air Quality Index of 74, CM Rekha Gupta highlighted the government's ongoing efforts to reduce the city's pollution, and claimed that for the first time in a decade, the index has come down to such a satisfactory level.

title: 'Find Balanced, Humane Solution': Minister To Mumbai Civic Body On Pigeon Feeding Ban
content: Taking note of the situation arising after restrictions were imposed on feeding pigeons in Mumbai, Maharashtra Minister Mangal Prabhat Lodha has written to the Mumbai municipal commissioner of Mumbai for some kind of a solution.

title: Julian Assange Joins Massive Pro-Palestine Protest On Sydney Harbour Bridge
content: Tens of thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters, including WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge on Sunday, closing the world-famous landmark.

title: 4 Under Trial In Rape, POCSO Act Cases Escape From Chhattisgarh Jail
content: Four prisoners facing trial in rape and POCSO Act cases escaped from a district jail in Chhattisgarh's Korba district.

title: Telugu Film Workers' Strike May Bring Big-Budget Productions To Standstill
content: The Telugu film industry is set to face a complete shutdown of shooting activities starting Monday after the Telugu Film Employees Federation announced a strike over a long-standing wage dispute with producers.

title: Centre Cuts Prices Of 35 Essential Medicines
content: In a move to make medicines more affordable for patients, the National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) has reduced the retail prices of 35 essential drugs sold by leading pharmaceutical companies.

title: How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Washington Commanders owner Josh Harris addressed reporters after striking one of the biggest deals in recent franchise history . Harris wore the expression of an athlete who had just won a big game . he grew up a fan of the team he bought from previous owner Dan Snyder for $6.05 billion in 2023 .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: WWE SummerSlam Night 1 results: Seth Rollins cashes in on CM Punk, becomes new champion
content: CM Punk defeated Gunther to become the new WWE world heavyweight champion . he had won a gauntlet match last month on "Raw" to earn the right to challenge him . former members of the Bloodline, cousins Roman Reigns and Jey Uso team up .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: What were the Twins thinking? Who is MLB's team to beat? Making sense of the trade deadline's biggest surprises
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . there's no team to beat in the American League, Bradford Doolittle says .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Fins' Tyreek Hill making hustle plays, rebuilding rapport with teammates
content: DL Warren Brinson is enjoying a training camp . the team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND JAX | KC | LAC | LAR | LV | MIA | MIN NE | NO | NYG | NYJ | P

title: Another slip up by India in the trade pact with the U.K.
content: There is a dilution of India’s backing of the more effective compulsory licensing to address the high prices of patented medicines

title: On the track towards belonging
content: More than a feat of engineering, completion of the line is a reaffirmation of a social contract between the people of Kashmir and the Indian Union

title: While in power AIADMK surrendered T.N.’s autonomy by backing Centre’s policies: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleges that the BJP-led government at the Centre allocated meagre funding to Tamil, the first language in India to be recognised as a Classical Language, while allocating several crores of rupees for Sanskrit

title: Delete caste column from appraisal forms: T.N. Police Commission
content: The panel, headed by former Judge of the Madras High Court Justice C.T. Selvam and other senior serving and former bureaucrats, says there is no need for the superior officer appraising the professional work to know the caste of the police personnel

title: Using ‘Bangladeshi for Bangla’ an insult to Bengali culture: Trinamool
content: The Trinamool Congress has been calling for Bengali Asmita over the targeting of migrant workers in BJP ruled states

title: Despite nod from officials, motorable road is still on paper for tribespeople in Marayur
content: Karimutty tribal settlement is just 350 m away from the Munnar-Udumalpet National Highway. There is only a dirt road connecting the NH to the settlement, despite multiple petitions from the tribespeople

title: Philippines President Marcos Jr. to visit India as two sides deepen maritime cooperation
content: President Marcos Jr. will hold delegation-level talks with Prime Minister Modi with the two sides signing multiple agreements and MoUs

title: Two doctors assaulted at hospital in Tripura’s Agartala; police inaction alleged
content: On-duty medical staff targeted by patient’s attendants; protest over repeated attacks and lack of accountability

title: Press Club of India seeks withdrawal of FIR against journalist in Himachal Pradesh
content: Press Club says action against reporter, portal for reposting victim’s account undermines press freedom

title: 58,000 personnel to be inducted in CISF over next five years, as Centre expects new industrial hubs in Maoist-affected States
content: President sanctions enhancement in CISF authorised ceiling strength, from 2 lakh to 2.2 lakh; present strength is 1.62 lakh; CISF official says about 14,000 to be recruited per year over next five years

title: Thousands march in silent rally in Kolhapur, demanding return of elephant Mahadevi by NGO Vantara
content: The Bombay High Court on July 16 had allowed the relocation of the elephant to Vantara’s facility in Gujarat, noting that the elephant had been kept in solitary confinement and was reportedly in poor health

title: Opposition rejects Odisha Police claim in minor girl’s death in Puri
content: State unit of Congress warns of a gherao of the office of the Director General of Police if no action was taken within seven days

title: How McLaren's split strategies helped Norris upset Piastri
content: the battle of the McLarens closes the gap in the drivers' championship . lando Norris and Oscar Piastri had come within centimeters of a collision on the penultimate lap of the hungarian grand prix . the battle between the two drivers was the same .

title: NYC gunman sought medical help before shooting
content: the gunman killed four people before taking his own life in a midtown Manhattan office building . he had sought medical help for frequent, debilitating headaches, a source says . the 27-year-old had regularly met with doctors, including a neurologist .

title: Comprehensive policy for Malayalam film industry within 2-3 months: Saji Cherian
content: Two-day Kerala Film Policy Conclave concludes. Minister says government has taken serious note of the issues raised by the junior artistes about their abject working conditions

title: Residents of Bengaluru’s Balagere protest over lack of basic civic infrastructure
content: Despite several complaints to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, there had been no action to rectify the situation

title: Forensic tech used to identify Prajwal Revanna in video evidence a first in State
content: The Special Court for MP/MLAs has appreciated the probe carried out by the SIT for “their limpid examination in adopting and utilising the modern technology of scientific examination”, terming it a “welcome step”

title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan courts controversy at Kerala Film Policy Conclave, Minister counters him
content: He calls for providing training to SC/ST and women filmmakers whose movies are funded by the government and to reduce the amount to ₹50 lakh from the present ₹1.5 crore

title: CPI(M) and Congress accuse BJP of claiming credit for the nuns’ release to score political brownie points
content: Schisms seemed to develop in the Church leadership over the question of whether the BJP national leadership had genuinely come to the aid of the nuns, as the party has claimed.

title: NDA seeks legal action against Tejashwi Yadav for allegedly holding two Voter ID cards
content: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the EPIC number cited by the RJD leader at a press conference was different from the one referred to by the ECI to refute his claim

title: Joshi says Rahul’s electoral malpractice charge is baseless
content: He should approach Election Commission of India if he has any evidence, according to the Union Minister

title: Tiruchi Corporation awaiting funds for Cauvery riverfront project
content: The civic body has identified a 1.5-km stretch between the Tiruchi-Chennai national highway bridge and railway track on Odathurai Road, and a 750-metre stretch between Amma Mandapam and Geethapuram in Srirangam for the project

title: SIR brings the INDIA bloc together for first physical meeting since June 2024
content: LoP Rahul Gandhi to host a dinner meeting for INDIA bloc leaders at his Delhi residence on August 7, followed by a joint protest march to the Election Commission headquarters the following day

title: A.P. government puts curbs on entry into school premises
content: The official directive by School Education Department has not gone down well with student unions, who have demanded immediate withdrawal of the decision

title: Row over Urology department HoD’s Facebook post: expert panel recommends measures for hassle-free supply of equipment
content: Although his intention was good, Dr. Haris Chirackal has violated the code of conduct for government employees, Committee observes

title: Chief Minister Naidu hails success of ‘She Leads Andhra’ pilot project in Kuppam
content: The Chief Minister announces an action plan to expand the project across the State, it is expected to cover over one lakh women across A.P. during a three-year action plan, covering 50 lakh households, says KADA Project Director

title: Amala Medical College launches AI system for drug safety
content: Partnership with DoctorAssist.AI introduces ‘SafeRx’ to enhance antibiotic stewardship and clinical decision-making.

title: Six Odisha workers killed in rock collapse at granite quarry in A.P.’s Bapatla district
content: Three other injured are undergoing treatment and are said to be out of danger; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu expresses grief over the tragedy, orders probe

title: Experts to discuss Tamil Nadu’s urban growth, real estate transformation at The Hindu summit
content: At the August 5 event, there will be focus on sustainable, inclusive, and forward-looking real estate strategies with respect to the State’s vision of becoming a trillion-dollar economy

title: Air India cancels Singapore-Chennai flight due to technical issue
content: "Arrangements are being made to fly the passengers to Chennai at the earliest. Hotel accommodation is being provided, and full refunds on cancellation, or complimentary rescheduling is also being offered to passengers based on their preference," Air India said.

title: Andhra Pradesh Health Minister calls for Indianisation of industry
content: Satya Kumar Yadav emphasises need to reflect Indian values in products and services while meeting global standards

title: Annamayya police launch ‘Operation Trace’ to unite missing girls with families
content: The campaign which commenced on August 1 will continue till month-end and a drive at railway stations, bus stands, religious places, and red-light areas will begin from August 11, says Superintendent of Police Vidyasagar Naidu

title: Sunnam Rajayya remembered on 5th death anniversary
content: Koyas observed the 5th deah anniversary of three-time CPI(M) MLA of Bhadrachalam Assembly constituency at his native place in Sunnamvarigudem in Chintoor agency The three-time CPI(M) MLA of Bhadrachalam fought for the rights of Polavaram project displaced, tendu leaf collectors, and bamboo collectors in Godavari Valley

title: Scholars and seer spar over religion status demand at book release event in Bagalkot
content: The debate comes about during the release of the former Chief Minister Veerappa Moily’s book, Vishwa Samskara Mahayana Volume-3

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what’s next
content: quarterback dak Prescott and receiver ceeDee Lamb didn't get their respective new deals done until close to the season . on friday, parsons posted on social media that he is requesting a trade . "i no longer want to play for the Dallas Cowboys," he wrote .
